post: Men who fall asleep in under a minute marry women who toss and turn for hours. Those men are lucky not to be suffocated by a pillow nightly.
The first time you see a description of someone *younger* than you as “elderly” is a new kind of pain.
Every day there is more horror movie type stuff coming out about Epstein and his cronies. Hell itself doesn’t want to be associated with this level of evil.
You are lovable. You deserve the biggest Valentine’s card in the pack, with all the glitter. That special card is all for you.
You are never prepared for the death of your mother.
As an attorney, I can confirm that if I acted like Pam Bondi in court, the judge would have the bailiff haul me off to jail. And I would deserve it.
Now is the time for anyone with an eidetic memory to reach out to your Congressional representative to assist with reviewing the Epstein documents.

All the people saying “I didn’t understand a word” about Bad Bunny should think back to 1958, when “La Bamba” by Ritchie Valens became the first Spanish language hit record. For context, this year was the height of the desegregation process, NASA was created, and Alaska became a state.
It’s amazing how triggered certain groups are over Bad Bunny. Realistically, white English-only speakers are the demographic most likely to shrink in the coming years.
Apparently, the owner of the Patriots is on Team MAGA, which makes it easy to hope for a Seahawks win.
People who think that Trump’s racist video is great are absolutely 100% disgusting.

The downside of family law: seeing how much people suck when dealing the people they supposedly love. Downside of probate law: seeing how the people who supposedly loved you are only interested in what they get now that you’re dead.
It feels so wrong for men of Hispanic descent to work for ICE arresting people who could be their distant relatives.

I am absolutely not interested in what “celebrities” wear, or what they do not wear. I think if they all showed up buck naked per recent trends, fashion designers and stylists might be the only ones who care.
I just saw my delivery guy test my screen door to make sure it could open and allow me to get my package. I wish they could all be that thoughtful!

There are ways to trip up facial recognition software. Use makeup effects and neon colors to make your face asymmetrical. The systems hone in on your nose, so adhere beads on your bridge, and grow out your bangs. Wear clothing printed with real faces. I am sure you can think of worthy candidates.

I remember my grandmother setting up an ironing board and doing every piece of laundry, even my granddad’s underwear. Me? I know I own an iron, but have no idea where it is. My dryer is my wrinkle remover. I think this is a sign of progress for women. Time is valuable.
Tom Homan is almost Human, which is the closest he can be to it.
I am always floored by the people who want to know which coffee shops, restaurants and stores are open the morning after several inches of snow and ice coated the streets overnight.
The type of man who is interested in working for ICE tells you exactly what is wrong with ICE.
What kind of execution by ICE would finally be a breaking point for MAGA? A 6 year-old? A pregnant woman? Someone in a wheelchair? A Republican Senator? A nun? What life would be of value?
The government does not like the First Amendment. Murder should not be the direct outcome of that.
My husband was flipping through channels, and I heard an elderly sounding man talking. I looked up and realized it was Trump! I remarked on how I didn’t recognize him because he sounded so weak.

We are expecting a snowpocalypse this weekend, which means that you can’t find milk, eggs, or packages of chicken. This last one is a new, and inexplicable, shortage. I knew better than to look at the toilet paper aisle, and I assume that it was a wasteland.
Trump is out of town. Can we lock the doors and pretend we aren’t here? Maybe he will go away…
I just watched The Rip. Much as I enjoyed seeing Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and Kyle Chandler, my heart was stolen by the handsome and charismatic Wilbur.
Tom Cotton is running scared. I, and many others in Arkansas, received a text yesterday attacking his opponent, Hallie Shoffner. I really hope that she wins.

Regarding the Nobel Prize presentation to Trump by Machado: because that was a gift to a President, federal law dictates that it belongs to the National Archives, not to Trump personally. He is still a loser.
Someday her Nobel Prize will be returned to her by a real president.
More people need to film Trump to catch him doing things like flipping off American citizens. We need to be citizen reporters against this administration.
If a certain someone were to pass away, I think the administration would delay sharing that news as long as possible.
It helps if you realize that you are about to get to court an hour early and turn around before you get there.

I have seen a rap sheet going around purportedly that of Renee Good with lots of charges. It’s a fake. It has the wrong birthdate. All she had was a traffic ticket in 2012. Don’t let the MAGA liars smear her.

I will say it again: filming ICE is an excellent idea. Don’t do it with your phone, though. You don’t want the officer to take it or break it. Also, holding it robs you of the use of a hand. Instead you should use cameras that attach to your clothes or are otherwise concealed.
If an ICE agent kills me, know that I plan to haunt that guy forever. He would never have a peaceful night sleep, uninterrupted sex, or a moment without feeling my presence.
It’s amazing how what you can see with your own eyes is subject to spin and lies.

Nostradamus: “In the Palace the people shall be caught, And by a good Sign the City shall be besieged"". This one caught my attention with the death of Renee Nicole Good. “The Palace”could be the US Capitol on Jan. 6.
ICE is way too eager to kill people, whether they are in custody or not.

Starting Feb. 1, Arkansas prisoners will no longer be able to receive books mailed to them. I understand that it was a method of sending drugs, but better screening methods would be a better solution.
I am not the type of person to want someone dead, but I would certainly not participate in a day of mourning.

I love when dogs 1. Have human names (Huey, Fiona) 2. Are named after food (Flapjack, Bacon) 3. Come as a match set (Bonnie, Clyde) Basically, no matter what name you give your dog, I will be delighted to meet him or her.
Healthcare for all would be less expensive and better for more Americans than “running” Venezuela.
If another country were to invade the United States and kidnap our president and First Lady, we need to be clear about a few things: 1. No returns 2. No refunds

Stranger Things! Let’s talk about the s5 surprises in the Wheeler family. Mrs. Wheeler fought a demogorgon, wounded it with just a broken bottle, and survived. She got out of her hospital bed to blow up another one. And Holly ruined all of Henry’s plans and rescued her friends. Powerful.
Just finished the Stranger Things finale. The last half hour had Stephen King feeling to me. I am guessing it was the Duffer Brothers’ homage to him.
I wish that I were a talented and famous entertainer so I could cancel my performances at the Kennedy Center. I would do something for free on streaming.

My plans for New Year’s Eve: hiding at home, reading a real book, wearing comfy jammies, and not having a hangover to start 2026. I have a feeling I need to be alert for whatever the coming year throws at me.
It’s amazing how Fox talking heads spend so much time just agreeing with each other. Loudly.

I saw a little whisp of a fluff ball canine running at me in Lowe’s yesterday. I gave her the petting she politely requested. Her dog bro, a massive Pitt bull, looked sadly at me, mostly because many people avoid him. He also got his share of petting, and he was a very good boy.
Nero used gold leaf all over his villas. Trump is certainly emulating him.
What day is it? Saturday? Sunday? Mid-week holidays are so confusing.
Merry Christmas! Be a gift and a blessing to your family and friends!
It is going to be in the mid 70’s here today and tomorrow. No Christmas sweaters. No hot cocoa. No blazing fireplace. Tell me again how climate change is a hoax.

I love giving random and true compliments. “That dress is beautiful!” “Your eyeliner is totally on point!” “I dig that shirt!” “You did great in court!” I always get a huge smile from the recipient. It’s a small way to brighten someone’s day and make them feel seen. I encourage everyone to do it.
It seems to me that once the first member of this administration gets punished for legal and ethical misconduct, many others will follow. The dam just needs to break.
Any fan of Star Trek will understand this image…it’s where we are thanks to the Trump administration.
I saw a car with a sticker that said “I hope that something good happens to you today.” I knew instantly that the driver was not MAGA.
The best part of Christmas is remembering all the ones in the past, filled with the love of family long gone. Each year is to be cherished.
The sellers took some of the curtains with them. I am feeling on display in front of these windows at night. Curtains have moved to the top of my shopping list.
I, like so many fans, will remember and honor Rob Reiner by watching several of his excellent movies.
Medical side effects that include constipation AND diarrhea make me wonder if the cure is worth it…
My heart goes out to Australia. Certain things so common in America should never happen elsewhere.
When masks were required during the pandemic, I matched them to my outfit and owned it like a fashion accessory.
I really enjoyed Bruce Willis playing against type in Death Becomes Her.
Maybe the next reporter Trump insults will be a white man, preferably from Fox. What will MAGA do?

The Arkansas Gazette won two Pulitzer Prizes for supporting law and order (integration). It subsequently lost a newspaper war to a lower quality paper, and was consumed into the Arkansas Democrat-Gazette. The paper has not denounced the Nazis who came to Little Rock, which shows how far it fell.
My boss said, “You sound terrible, and you look like Gollum. Go home.” I am self-employed.
Out of state Nazis marched in Little Rock yesterday. They all covered their faces and spouted racist slogans at Central High.
Every time I get sick, I am thankful that we have moved beyond leeches and snake oil.
Too many people are scarily eager for the death of people they perceive as lower than themselves in race, money or gender.
I think that Trump has Canada next in line if he can’t take over Venezuela.
My new neighbor welcomed us to the neighborhood. I know that he has a dog. I am on a quest to introduce myself to that dog.
I closed on my house today. I am cursing the painters who got white all over the otherwise fine wood floors.
Anyone else think Hitler would have received a pardon, followed by a reception in his honor where Trump would say the man was railroaded and misunderstood by the evil Antifa?
I wonder if that towel was superglued to Glen Powell in The Running Man. I was hoping that gravity would work its magic.

Thanksgiving is an American holiday. Many other countries celebrate the fall harvest. Modern focus has shifted from knowing that hard work has ensured winter survival to a feast and appreciation of family time together. Enjoy yours, and don’t talk politics.
Food made with love is 1000% healthier, with more flavor and fewer calories.
When you select your clothes for a flight, always remember that there is a chance you will be exiting down a slide and running from the burning wreckage of a plane. Dress accordingly.
Peter Lorre was such a perfect sketchy bad guy.

I know that appraisers are mostly interested in justifying a sales price for a bank to approve a mortgage. Mine used a comp from a run down area of town instead of acknowledging that I got a hell of a deal.
I was cleaning the bathroom. A handheld sprayer is convenient until you accidentally spray yourself with it. Sigh.
I saw a guy riding a motorcycle yesterday wearing a mascot-type rabbit’s head instead of a helmet. I had many questions about both the safety and wisdom of such a choice.

Just so you know: in the early 1900s, men who found their wives to be inconvenient hustled them off to an insane asylum. My state still has a law that a divorce could be granted against the insane spouse, but the other party was responsible for their care until death.
If a man wearing horrible makeup and a dead ferret on his head called me “Piggy,” he would certainly hear choice words about his own appearance.
I am watching my stocks tank faster than a Republican approval rating.

I’m running for public office. This morning, a person wrote a post attacking me. Unlike Trump and his cronies, I didn’t attack back. I said that if I win office, I would treat them with respect and courtesy, because I would represent everyone, not just the ones who vote for me.

When I was 15, I was dealing with zits, teachers, finding my clique, and trying to control my hair. I was absolutely a kid. What I want to know: where were the victims’ parents? How could these pedophiles have such access to the girls?
One thing about those Epstein e-mails: always proofread your e-mails before hitting send, just in case they end up in court.

With all the gaudy gold gewgaws in the White House, it looks like a worn-out Vegas hooker with sequins everywhere. All that glitters isn’t real gold. I can’t think of a more apt metaphor for this administration.
You can judge a country by how it treats those who served, fought, and died for it.
I just turned 59. It’s unsettling to see news stories about people this age (or younger) with an elderly implication. I don’t feel like I am on my last legs.
I watched Frankenstein (2025) today. It is visually stunning! I highly recommend it.
What I love about online menus is my ability as a picky person to see if a restaurant has anything I want to eat…or if I will just go somewhere else.

It seems that Trump is not paying the company that tore off the East Wing. If only there were hundreds if not thousands of people who complained of this very thing in the last several decades so they could have some warning of what a perfect businessman he is.
I wonder what kind of obscenity-filled tirade happened in the White House when Trump got news of all the Democrat wins.

My Facebook memories showed me a post I made 10 years ago: “Nothing makes you want to run for local political office like seeing the wrong person in said office.” I hadn’t even started law school in 2015. I’m currently running for office to replace a really wrong man. Things work out eventually.

I told my husband that I made some new friends! Lucy, a beautiful yellow lab in training to be a service dog, and her big brother Harold, a handsome shepherd mix. Hubby, for some silly reason, asked the names of the humans they were with. I have no clue….
In case you didn’t know, if you fall asleep with your face on your fist, you wake up looking like you got punched in the mouth.
Halloween candy only has half the calories on November 1st, right?
I would recoil in horror if Stephen Miller showed up at my door tonight with his Stephen Miller face on. Terrifying!
I paid my mortgage off yesterday. The teller high fived me and told me congratulations. He was sweet!
I don’t like the home insurance database where a claim from decades ago with one blackballs you for eternity with every other company.
If I get to the point where I brag about passing a dementia test, I need to be tested again. Something isn’t right.
Just FYI, some members of Mensa, comprising the top 2% of human intelligence, are also Trump-worshipping MAGATS. In the face of facts, they (mostly men, no surprise) respond with personal insults.
I am rewatching The DaVinci Code. Ron Howard and Tom Hanks created magic.
If you can’t pass an open book test, and you are so ashamed of your job that you hide your face, maybe ICE isn’t the best career path.
It is so odd to see MAGA insisting that only one part of the East Wing was removed despite images showing the entire thing is GONE.
I feel like Maria Ouspenkaya seeing the pentagram on Larry Talbot’s hand, but it’s about the doom awaiting America.

When we get a true American president, certain people will complain that restoring the Rose Garden, stripping the tacky gold embellishments off the White House, and imploding the ballroom would be wasteful.
I can’t imagine the MAGA mental gymnastics that make destroying the East Wing of the White House okay.

During the Russian revolution, they knew better than to destroy the Imperial jewels. Some were sold to Westerners, but many comprise the Kremlin Diamond Fund, a treasure trove of glittering historical artifacts.
Maybe, just maybe, the Orange One might realize that he loves himself more than many Americans do.
The sellers accepted our offer on the house! Now I am constantly thinking of improvements, furniture placements, and paint colors.

My husband and I looked at a house in the historic area of our town yesterday. The neighbors saw us, introduced themselves, and began telling us all the great things about the house and the area. Safe to say that they would love for us to move in. We are making an offer today.
I would rather support Americans with $40 billion of our tax money.

The Republican men who use racial slurs and profess their admiration of Hitler are shocked, shocked I say, that Americans don’t like them. I feel like defiantly singing the Star Spangled Banner at them in Rick’s Cafe.
I went to the library today and saw a little girl excited to carry the books she picked out. We need more of this.
This is the time of year where you hear “Thriller” about six times a day, and you have to stop yourself from doing the zombie dance.
As a retirement perk, I can still be on my employer’s health insurance plan by paying my own premium. This year I started getting letters encouraging me to find my own plan. Cheap bastards.
Trump will establish his own Peace Prize, with himself as the first recipient.
Anyone else 100% sure that Trump has made comments about whether he finds Maria Corina Machado attractive?
MAGA is convinced that ANTIFA has a headquarters, a leader, uniforms, and branches all over the country. What about membership cards? Monthly meetings?
Why? Why do I always have to deal with the most awful opposing counsel? They get in such a blood lust about “winning” that they ignore what their clients want done. It’s insane.
Stephen Miller is the poster child for men who make women instinctively uncomfortable.
Sometimes people make stupid mistakes. Sometimes an attorney makes that mistake on their behalf.
Suggestion: protesters should wear shirts that say “I am an American citizen.” That would be fair warning that ICE does not have jurisdiction to touch them.
Would anyone object if the Golden Ballroom is imploded when this nightmare is over?
It’s another day in court, against the most misogynistic attorney in the state.

Let’s follow the example of America’s generals. Resisters need to fill the seats wherever Trump spears and sit in stony silence with arms crossed. He needs to know that a large part of the country dislikes him and his harmful policies.

Some female attorneys only wear black or sedate colors. I wear red when I want to keep attention on me. Pink or other delicate colors are for the temperamental old school judge who likes to yell at attorneys but restrains himself because I look so ladylike.
If you want to record ICE, your phone will attract their attention. Look for a small body cam, which will be unobtrusive—and keep you safer.
Attorney note: the second hardest person to question is a pathological liar. The hardest is a pathological liar who works as a car salesman.
I encourage the people of Portland to stand strong in the face of an invasion by the Trump administration.
Companies that issue recall notices vastly underestimate my intent to buy an item and eat it the same day.

Men who want to father children are told to avoid acetaminophen because of potential sperm irregularities, just like they shouldn’t consume alcohol or drugs. Their contribution to fertilization is just as important as the egg.
I am annoyed at American news programs that invite talking heads from England to analyze American politics. The fancy accent does not fool me into believing them.
If I were at the UN, I would not have been able to resist laughing at the rambling loser in thick makeup.
Of course they blame autism on women taking Tylenol during pregnancy, not on men taking it who could have screwed up their sperm….
For some reason, adding or subtracting 8 always makes my brain react like a kid on a bike hitting a speed bump. A bit of shock, then random flailing.
I think if MAGA knew what fascism actually was, many would realize that they are Antifa.
One day I want to rub a baby elephant’s fuzzy head, become its best friend, and receive the ear flapping of happiness.
When a delightful Southern gentleman proclaims that you are a dandy, that is high praise indeed.
Robert Redford was breathtakingly gorgeous as a young man.
Right now, I am contemplating making a voodoo doll. Trust me, the dude deserves a few well-placed pins.

We went to a restaurant. My meal came out first and was delicious. I was almost done when his completely wrong overcooked burger came. One of us (me) is content. The other is grumbling, and he had to pay.
Can someone please develop better bulletproof technology that we can all use daily?
I think open air events are too dangerous for everyone.
I had a bit of a news blackout while traveling yesterday. And then I found out that the Supreme Court Nazi Brigade exceeded expectations on horrible decisions.
I am having a mimosa before boarding my flight. It has orange juice, so it’s healthy. Or that is what I tell myself.
The Old Town Trolley in San Antonio is great way to see the town and learn more about it.
Although people make fun of long lines at women’s bathrooms, there is nothing as efficient as women waiting for a stall at an airport.
My little wish is that I could have pretty handwriting. Alas, I am left-handed and doomed to failure in this.
Any day in which I see a dog is automatically a good day.
I saw a rainbow on my way to work this morning. I hope that it’s a sign of a good day to come.
I found a tick on meeee. The fact that I am delicious is not reassuring.
Another great thing about my new library card is the access to apps with ebooks, audiobooks, and movies. Always be suspicious of a government that is anti-libraries.
I got a library card this morning after many years of being too busy to read for fun. I am already halfway through the book I checked out. This is a lovely way to spend a holiday weekend.
I highly recommend The Thursday Murder Club on Netflix. I certainly hope to have friends like those in my old age.
A fasting blood test just reminds me that I like food, on a regular basis.
FYI. Life insurance companies have lingo in their policies that they don’t have to pay if you were involved in illegal activities when you die. This is often used in drug overdose cases.
Adulting: you can eat chocolate any time of day or night. Nobody tells you no!
If you are ever in a hotel room that doesn’t have storage space in the bathroom, set up the ironing board and use that.
Nothing like checking into one of the most haunted hotels in America and finding *your room* featured in a book in the lobby for its poltergeist activity!
The doctor dilated my eyes yesterday. Interesting fact: light eyes dilate faster than brown eyes but take longer to recover.
Eventually the day will come where I give up my contacts for glasses. Today is not that day.
If you want to do damage, don’t throw a sandwich. Find yourself a coconut.
I apparently got wrapped up in Allergicitis thornitica, so named scientifically by me. This thorny vine causes lots of itchy blisters and reminds me that nature and I can’t be friends.
I miss the days when we all acknowledged that Russia was not America’s bestie.
I think dogs fully understand when I ask their human “Can I pet your dog?” The dogs always answer “Yes!”
The best thing about being your own boss is setting up a meeting with your couch at home for all afternoon.
The heat outside that could easily dehydrate food in an oven setting reminds me that I am made of meat and should stay indoors.
As schools all over America reopen for the fall, I have a sense of dread about school shootings. The nuts are getting so angry about “illegals” that I am afraid they will hunt the kids.

Hubby and I were talking about if we were on a plane and saw a creepy older guy bothering a much younger woman. He said he would probably say something. I would move to sit next to her & tell her I was her favorite aunt. I would block that guy! Women know that probably isn’t the right response.
Nothing makes you more positive that people absolutely never listen to a voicemail message than having a phone number that used to belong to someone else.
I saw #Weapons today. It was a smart, well-written flick with a talented cast. This is what we want: original movies and NOT rehashing and rebooting the same plots.
Sometimes it’s my job as an attorney to fix what other attorneys did wrong. I wish law schools did more hands-on education of the *how* to do what we do.
I watched The Net (1995, Sandra Bullock) last night. The graphics, the modems, and the 15-pound laptops gave me flashbacks. Also the bad guy was a rich New Yorker. Who could have seen that coming?
Has anyone considered that the Buffalo might have paid to hunt a millionaire?
Yes, Covid is still a thing. My son was diagnosed yesterday. I had taken him to the doctor in my car, so I am on the definitely been exposed list.
The younger generation has no idea how to use checks to pay bills. Many don’t have a checkbook on their account, so trying to make a non-electronic payment is mind boggling.
Pessimistic clothing choice: I always dress for a flight as if I will be running on the tarmac away from the flaming hulk of the plane. No high heels, no tight skirts.
I don’t think there is enough room in America for Americans and MAGA. I hope the Americans win.
It is so easy for men to change their appearance with mustache, beard, clean shaven, or stubbled. Add hair…or lack of it…men are human chameleons.
A ballroom is planned by a man who can’t dance….
The President least likely to pass it is bringing back the Presidential Fitness Test.
I have noticed that my grocery bill has increased dramatically in the last year.
Trump cheated at business. He cheated in politics. He cheated at marriage. Nobody is shocked that he cheated at golf.
That baby in Fantastic Four is easily the most beautiful to ever be in a movie.
What I love about my church is seeing grandparents on both sides with grandkids who go from pew to pew to say hi and give hugs.
I am going out to dinner tonight, so I have not eaten much today in order to have the most empty space in my tummy.
Anyone else think Maxwell will blame Epstein for everything, have a retrial, go free, and become a darling of the Republican Party?
No big shock that Trump is named in the Epstein files. The big question is if he is named more than anyone else.
My big Epstein questions: Where were the parents of these teenagers? Why would they send their daughters to spend unsupervised time with men?
I would confess to just about anything if the cops would give me a root beer float during my interrogation.

My state is forecasting a whole week of temperatures well over 100, which for no reason at all makes me think of recipes where things can be dried out by cooking at low heat in the oven for extended periods.
When a medication commercial includes the phrase “may cause death,” maybe you should avoid it.

ICE gets access to Medicaid information. What’s to stop the government from sorting it to find out the people the most money has been spent on and kicking them off in the name of preventing waste? It is eugenics.
Apparently Trump does not have as much artistic ability as Hitler.

I am going to run for political office next year. I have never run for anything, so it’s a brand new and scary world. But my city deserves better than the incumbent, and I am the right woman for the job.
My life goal is to write a book that gets banned.
Casablanca- “You repeat Third Reich as though you expected there to be others,” evil Nazi Major Heinrich Strasser said to Captain Renault. I think we are experiencing the Fourth Reich.
Life advice: You need to find the horse that bucked you off, give him an apple, talk sweet to him, and ride again. Either that or you walk home.
When the rule of law is ignored and due process is impeded, things like racial profiling replace probable cause. You don’t want to know what comes next…
I do enjoy reading articles where Trump is stressed out, the poor thing.
Imagine being deaf and surrounded by masked ICE agents. How would you know what they were saying? If cops don’t mask, neither should ICE.
Whenever I see a picture of very tan Elizabeth Taylor, I am reminded of how much better she looked pale.
I like my steak medium rare. A cow standing outside on a hot July day is half done already.
Isn’t it time to redesign airplanes to give each passenger a dedicated storage spot? That would eliminate a lot of the bickering from passengers.

People will lose their Medicaid. They will rely on emergency rooms for care. Hospitals won’t be able to absorb these costs. The hospital will either close entirely…or it will stop providing emergency room care unless the patient pays in advance. Either way, people will suffer.
Always a pleasant surprise to find a car repair shop open on a Sunday.
Trump is as welcome on my tv as a fly is on my toothbrush, for a lot of the same reasons.
There are some scenes from the movie Independence Day that I would not mind seeing in the real.
If I were a member of Congress and Trump wanted to meet with me to “close a deal,” he would find out that I say no. And that is the last word.
You remember how Trump wanted to reopen Alcatraz? He obviously wanted to put a concentration camp there. He chose Florida as the next best alternative.

Medicaid funds the insurance for 400,000 low income children in my state. Kids are 38% of the Medicaid recipients. I think MAGA might not realize where the money comes from because the name of the program does not reference Medicaid itself.
I am proud of a lot of things. Lately, it’s that I am not a Republican.
Sunday is a great day to bake cookies, in case you were looking for something to do.
The picture of the senior citizens in their wheelchairs with their wrists zip-tied should haunt Republicans forever.
Some people find that there are downsides to their jobs, like when a restaurant refuses to serve a political toady. I hope that masked ICE agents experience that kind of public shaming.
Men who like for other non-related people to call them daddy have serious issues.
If humans were obliterated, I hope elephants, dogs, whales, dolphins and giraffes take over the planet.

I fully support law enforcement being required to show their faces, have a badge with ID, and identify themselves when interacting with people. They demand to see a license when you are driving. They need to show their authenticity back.
The Rose Garden covered in concrete is a perfect metaphor for modern America. Beauty, nature and history mean nothing to Trump and his MAGA cult.

If a draft by lottery is initiated, the first ones would be those turning 20 in that calendar year. It would go up to 25, but if more bodies are needed, service could be expanded to age 35. Remember that straight white men are absolutely preferred for Trump’s army, unless they are rich.

If you voted for him, I hold you responsible for Iran. You chose this. You chose him. For the third time, you had a chance to reject his vitriol, to condemn his criminality, to prevent his lawlessness, to denounce his bigotry—and you flat-out refused. johnpavlovitz.substack.com/p/to-the-peo...

When Jaws was released, my parents took my older sister and me to see it. Midway, we went for popcorn and returned to the entire theater still reeling from something scary. It took years for the movie to be on tv so I could finally see the bobbing head scene.
A letter from a man that includes the phrase “I don’t mean to be disrespectful” before misstating an aspect of law is actually quite disrespectful.
Maybe Elon should load a SpaceX rocket with fireworks and launch it on the 4th of July so it will get a bigger bang.
I will say it again, take political party off your voter registration. Make it harder for Trump’s minions to target you.
The five pounds you gain on vacation are the least pleasant souvenirs.
A bug crawling on you brings about 100 imaginary friends that you feel for hours.

I am so proud of everyone who made their voices heard yesterday. I, like many others, wasn’t able to participate. I think with the people who supported them, the actual count would increase exponentially.
For everyone protesting today: Stay safe, be smart, and record everything.
You don’t really feel like you are 100% back from a trip until all the laundry is done.
My flex as a hearing impaired person is always turning on closed captioning on hotel room TVs. The next inhabitants might not be able to figure out all the submenus to enable it.

Hot Springs Arkansas is a beautiful city. I recommend staying at the Oaklawn Resort. It is a new facility, and I am in the best hotel room I have ever had. It’s got one and a half baths with a separate living room and a view of the track.

Someone, aka an Evil Bastard, ran over two ducks at the Duck Crossing in my city. Where in the hell did he need to go so urgently that he couldn’t wait a minute for them to cross? Would he also run over a child?
Marriage is having the temptation to smother your snoring spouse in his sleep. Love is kicking him instead and then feigning sleep so he thinks he just had a bad dream.

I think a big part of the problem with ICE is the type of person often drawn to work as an agent. We’ve seen the extremely racist posts on their message boards. These are people who are eager to inflict pain and suffering on those they perceive as less than human. Clean house & set good policies.
Are we ready for another Kent State type massacre? It could happen in any American city. The National Guard should not be given orders to murder citizens.
I can’t wait for ICE to pick up a judge who happens to be of Hispanic descent. That would be the most epic mistake.
Nonnas is a great movie! Excellent story with a heart, great dialog and engaging acting.
In the Musk and Trump snipe fest, I would prefer they actually joust instead of using words. And televise it, please.

My hubby was in the room when I was recording an answering machine message. (Me: Ugh. Damn. Start over. Repeat.) He listened to my final version. He: You sound like you’re five. Me: That’s why telemarketers ask if my mama is home.
Fox News must be feeling like the awkward girl in a high school friend group when the two cool kids aren’t getting along. Do they support Trump or Musk?
In the past several years, I have thrown two individuals out of my office. Both were white men who were shocked when they realized that *I* did not want to work for them.

The bonkers theory Trump spouted that Biden was executed and replaced with a robot sounds like the plot of a sci fi movie. If he can’t distinguish reality from fiction, we need to cut the streaming service to the White House.
I survived the 1980’s without buying a jean skirt or parachute pants.
I am up appallingly early on a Saturday. The plus side is I am going fishing for the first time this year. I love getting a big one that puts up a fight!
Dynamo in Running Man from 1987 is driving a Cybertruck! The movie predicted Musk…unless he copied it and hoped nobody would notice!

Running Man: released in 1987, set in 2017. Host Richard Dawson as Killian is completely Trump-like, even to using the adjective “beautiful.” And Dynamo drives what looks like a Cybertruck. It’s eerily predictive of today! (Story was set in 2025…creepy!)
Me to husband: Am I bothering you? He, exasperated tone: What do you think? Me: No. (Silly man should not let me pick my own answer.)
You couldn’t pay me to live in certain states in America.
The kind of robot I want would dust, mop, scrub toilets, do laundry, and cook. It makes me feel like a man looking for a 1950’s wife.
I remembered that I need to focus on myself and my family this Memorial Day. I didn’t bring any work home.
It is commendable that the West Point graduates were silent as a demented elderly man ranted at them.
The best ice cream is mint chocolate chip. For some reason, women love it while most men hate it.
All the Trump posts ending with “Thanks for your attention to this matter” sound like he is asking the maintenance department to refill the toilet paper in the executive bathroom.
When you wake up at midnight and can’t go back to sleep, your entire day stinks.
There is eccentric, and there’s also how nature says, “Beware!”
When I hear people praising the Big Beautiful Bill, I wonder if they know what’s in it. It’s a Bad Baffling Brutal Bill that will hurt many of the most vulnerable Americans.
You can diet, or you can let pizza make you happy.
I could not afford to live next to any new South African immigrant. I will most likely earn less money but pay more taxes than they do.
Another Saturday night, but I got somebody.
I have a few courtroom rules: 1. Dress sharp. 2. Be well-prepared. 3. Don’t gloat when the judge yells at a witness for coyly trying to avoid answering my direct question. 4. Always have a pen handy.
I would pick a werewolf boyfriend over a vampire any day. I would be happy, saying “Who is a good puppy?” to my werewolf. Ear scratches, belly rubs, not caring about fleas.
Is there a shudder of fear in MAGAland with the potential criminalization of porn? Men are the largest consumers of porn by far.

I am usually a margarita gal. Last night I ordered a bourbon cocktail that had peach purée in it. The bartender was extra generous with the alcohol. I was a giggly mess on the way home. Around midnight I was fumbling for Tylenol to stave off a headache. Tequila never mistreated me like that!

History lesson: in 1945 the Soviet Union gave the American ambassador in Moscow a large wooden replica of the US seal. It was placed behind his desk. It was actually a passive listening device, not discovered for 7 years. How many bugs can fit on an airplane given by a foreign nation?
Call your mama! Tell her that you love and appreciate her, not just today but every day you can. One day you won’t have that chance.

I am sure that I would be a terrible: -professional cleaner -graffiti artist -snake wrangler -Olympic athlete -Shakespearean actress None of these came up in my career aptitude test in high school, but mortician was…because I like people. Live people.
I think that the pigeons near my building were sent by my arch nemesis.
An American pope from Chicago! Amazing news!

The best thing: seeing a daddy walking his daughter to elementary school, carrying her pink backpack and holding her hand. They were both smiling and clearly enjoying the time together. That is a true man and real father.
Every day I wake up wondering what Trump will do or say to piss off another group of people. He seems determined to hit them all.

You know the used car dealers with the bottom dollar cars nobody wants…but they are priced low so people who can’t afford to buy a good car can buy those? I bet that those cars will be Teslas. The brand is poison. The safety records are abysmal. Owners are trying to dump them to get anything else.

Muppets moment-Me to my son: I bought more marinara for you. It is in the fridge. There is another jar in the pantry. It's a SPARE-A-NARA. (I did a Fozzy Bear wocka wocka.). He: (Sam the Eagle expression) You worry me.
Sinners: go for the Blues, and get a bonus Irish jig. It’s a phenomenal movie on many levels. The Chinese grocery couple: 100% accurate.

May the 4th be with you! Star Wars instantly became a cultural icon on its release. I saw it on the big screen and was mesmerized. I had a crush on both Luke and Han. The Empire Strikes Back showed me that a sequel can build on the original and be even better. Lesson learned: be the Rebel.
Trump as Pope? Yeah, one of those popes long ago who had mistresses and secret children. I think he would fail miserably at being a spiritual leader.
There are times when I look forward to the end of an era. Particularly the Era of the Entitled White Person with an Entirely Undeserved Sense of Importance.
If you are a smart, strong, independent and self-assured woman, some man has called you a bitch, either to your face or behind your back. Obviously we all feel sorry for him and his hurt feelings.

The Rule of Law: All people and institutions are subject to the same laws. Basically, no one is above the law, and all are equal before the law. Any attorney who does not support this should be disbarred.

More people are losing their jobs. Farmers can’t afford to keep their land and earn a living. Kids are hungry. Money is worth less. All we need is Dorothea Lange and a lot of dust for this flashback to be exact.

I wish all the good things to Canada: a booming economy, strong and wise leadership, and international respect. (Basically everything Americans could have enjoyed if so many weren’t blithering idiots.)
I admit to every so often googling the names of guys who did me wrong, hoping to find an obituary. None yet, but hope springs eternal.
In a Star Trek world, this version of America would have a goatee. “Dammit Jim, I am not a democracy!”
I had forgotten how good The Hunt For Red October was! I enjoyed rewatching it this morning.

The fall in Trump’s public opinion numbers pleases me. As his policies hurt more Americans, that includes MAGA. Nobody is safe. Eventually, even the most brown-nosed Faux hosts will have to admit his errors. That will help open the eyes of the most brainwashed—fingers crossed!

Before you buy any appliance, find out who services the brand in your area. Only two people work on them in my entire state! I would never have bought an LG fridge in 2018, which became an unfixable dead weight in my kitchen. I replaced it with a Whirlpool yesterday. Service by the dealer!
If there has been a 71% fall in Tesla profits, I say there is 29% left to hit. Get crackin’ people!

I was busy with a hearing and neglected to buy extra chocolate for Easter. The populace rose up against me, issuing complaints. I was glad there were no pitchforks in the house. I am happy to report that the Great Chocolate Famine of 2025 has concluded with no loss of life.

I have long admired Pope Francis as a breath of fresh air. The sad thing is that I know many Catholics who are happy that he passed away, because they didn’t consider him a true pope or Catholic enough for them. Rest in peace.

The teachings of Jesus Christ are not a buffet where you can take only the parts that you like. That plate comes to you loaded up with morality, humanity, and generosity. On this Easter Sunday, it should be lesson number one for MAGA who claim to be Christian.

The thing about people saying they are going to carry their birth certificate. Can you see this? Nazi: Papers, please. You: Here is my birth certificate. I am a citizen. Nazi rips up your papers. That is the only official copy you had. Nazi: Papers, please. You don’t look like a citizen to me.

My husband after I gave him unsolicited and unwanted advice: What would I do without you telling me what to do? Me: You would be happier... He: That’s for damn sure.... Me...but you would do more things wrong.
Be aware that in any area where the courthouse closes for Good Friday, the attorneys often take the day off. Keep that in mind, and behave yourself.

Free speech: flipping someone off in public. This is protected expression. Oppression regime: cutting off the middle fingers of anyone doing the gesture. We need to safeguard our democracy and protect our constitutional rights.

I have an all-day hearing where the other attorney is a huge MAGA misogynist who has been a pain in the rear since day one. I am wearing a bright red suit. If one of us is gonna keep the courtroom’s attention today, it’s gonna be me.

My daughter and I watched Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan in You’ve Got Mail. I had to explain the antiquated technology to her. Me: There was a modem, and it made this noise (imitate it), and if you were lucky, you could get on the internet. She: And then you sharpened your spear for the mastodon hunt…

I think that if America were made of lots of little countries like Europe, there would have been wars about water. Some states have plenty of it, others face drought, and many have no direct access to the ocean for trade.

Even if a certain someone: -dropped dead on live tv with a Big Mac in his tiny hands -or got struck by lightning during a golf tournament -or experienced any of the millions of other ways people meet their maker every day… the magats would trot out a conspiracy theory that blames Democrats.

Yeah, I don’t see many Americans wanting to take a factory job. Fingers get crushed, metal gets in eyes, people get sucked into machines….and the owner doesn’t care because all those pesky safety regulations have been eliminated.
I saw a turtle on the shoulder of the interstate. Its shell was crushed, because it had been run over intentionally. I think there is a special place in hell for the bastard who would do that.
I remember when the tables at Wendy’s were covered in vintage ads. I loved reading all of them. It was a highlight of eating there, and I would move my food around to read them. Anyone else?
Every woman should own a red dress, sweater or shirt that makes her feel powerful and fabulous. (But no red ball caps. Those are stupid.)
So they brought back dire wolves? Two males and one female—that is a recipe for inbreeding. Massive inbred wolves with bizarre mutations…I would watch that movie, but I don’t want to live it.

There was a package on my porch that got delivered late last night. I am in my nightie. I look left. I look right. No cars. I step out. The box is heavier than expected. The wrestling begins to lift the box and keep the door open to get it inside. That’s when my neighbors drive by. All of them.
The last thing we need is a big military parade to kiss our dictator’s corpulent ass. But it would be a great opportunity for miles of protesting t-shirts.
Who wore it better? Hint: the one on the left is a true emperor. The one on the right puts tariffs on penguins and receives flightless birds flipped at him.
I can’t watch basketball. The squeaky shoes drive me up the wall. It’s all I hear.
I support the penguins.
I watched Top Secret as an homage to the late Val Kilmer. I had no idea he really sang all the songs! Total package: Dancer, singer, and so easy on the eyes.
It’s Noah-level rain expected in my state today. Keep an eye on your short people today. We are scared.
One perk of being raised right by good parents: nobody ever accuses you of being trashy, because you aren't.

Big awe of Cory Booker today! I want the next Senator to leave Strom Thurmond’s filibuster record in the dust to be a woman, with bonus points if she does it in heels. That racist rapist needs to be pushed to the bottom of history’s trash can.
History will speak glowingly of Cory Booker’s night. This is a profile in endurance and courage that few of his colleagues could match.

If you wonder if a convicted felon could receive a Nobel Peace Prize, recall that many Civil Rights advocates and dissidents against other governments were arrested and convicted. It would be difficult to start picking and choosing crimes that would result in ineligibility.

Ask any MAGA if they wanted the Gulf of Mexico renamed or Greenland taken by America last year. These are new concepts. If they heard Biden wanted them in his term, MAGAS would have thrown one holy hell of a tantrum about how illegal it would be.

I let my hair air dry because rain is expected today, resulting in a whole lot of curly hair doing whatever it wants. Husband looked at me and said: You sure are fluffy today. I did double check that he was talking about my hair-not my weight. (I would be planning his funeral & what to wear.)
Because the government is using tattoos as a reason to remove people, think long and hard before getting one. Also, look into the cost of removing or covering anything potentially problematic.
You know who also uses Signal? Your local city council, your governor, your senators and representatives. Anyone who wants to avoid those annoying Freedom of Information Act requests.

America is deporting adult workers and then loosening regulations so children can work long hours at those jobs. What they aren’t saying is that low-income children of color are the ones expected to fill those roles.
Of all the possible men named Pete, Buttigieg is among the best. Pete Hegseth? He needs to be thrown out of the Pete Society for besmirching the name.
Either both of my kids grew taller this weekend, or the water for my shower was way hotter than I thought. I am made of wool, it seems.

I previously said log out of social media on your burner phone if traveling. I am revising to state: 1. Delete any social media apps before you get to the border. 2. If you criticize a certain felon, do it in an account that is not your full name. Use a toss away email to log in to those.
There is no betrayal like when the waitress writes your order down, but the kitchen botches it in an unpalatable way.
Watching Reacher- Anthony Michael Hall’s glow up should be a lesson to never dismiss a geeky kid. Meow.
When a big hearing is canceled with short notice on a Friday, I take it as a sign from above to go home, put on leggings, and relax. The weekend is starting early!

Something to know-border control can search your phone and electronic devices. Leave your main device at home and only travel with a device with only necessary files. If you delete anything, make sure to delete it out of your deleted items too. Set social media so you must log in each time.
Some guys are weirdos. Some guys are bullies. Some guys are creepy. They deserve to be alone. Women are not obligated to talk to them, touch them (ick!), or be around them.
It’s been a long day. I shall fall face-first into Veal Marsala…..
I met a new neighborhood puppy yesterday! Tail wagging, perky ears, contented sighs…and the puppy seemed to enjoy it too.
I saw a guy come into the courthouse with a cartoon green four-leaf clover taped in the middle of his blue polo. He must have gotten a St. Patrick’s Day pinch!
Okay… I am short. I have red hair. I talk funny. I am part Irish. BUT I AM NOT A LEPRECHAUN!!! STOP TRYING TO CATCH ME!!

I had lunch at my favorite Mexican place. I was about to leave and decided one last chip was begging to deliver salsa to me. That was the dollop of salsa that landed front and center on my white shirt, betwixt my boobs.
Weekends are my favorite. They are the dessert after a broccoli and brussel sprout week.
There are people who do math problems for fun. These people are psychopaths. There are people who use correct grammar, spelling, and punctuation in texts. These people are wonderful.
The thing about Chuck Schumer: he’s always given me “rich dude” vibes. Maybe he wants one of those tax cuts….
If I ever veer off into a ditch, it will most likely be because I spotted a dog and got distracted admiring it. I usually say things like “What a good dog!” even though the good dog can’t hear me.
Just thinking—because Teslas are notoriously unsafe, is that part of an ultimate plan to bump off a certain orange-hued new owner?
I have been on a weight-loss mission. Me: Wow! These pants feel really loose. Looks down. Zips pants.

You wanna know why more prisons and detention centers are being built? Check the 13th Amendment. All this Reich needs is more inmates, and there won’t be any agriculture problems. You know what segment of the population already has skills in harvests.

I am a practicing attorney. My husband hasn’t practiced in decades. Men call him sometimes, saying they want him to tell ME what to do. He politely but firmly sets them straight. Only a fool tells a redhead what to do. And he’s no fool.

I saw recruitment commercials for the US military. Space Force was listed in the branches. I realized that I never heard anyone say they or anyone they knew was involved. I was curious about the numbers in each branch. Space Force is hoping to break the 9k figure this year.
On International Women’s Day, remember that your worth is not determined by any man’s opinion.

The villain sneered at me. He stroked his mustache and hissed, “Now you choose how I will dispose of you.” 1. A ride in a SpaceX rocket. 2. Driving a Cybertruck for a year. 3. A dip in piranha-infested waters wearing a beef bikini. I ponder my choice and odds of living. Me: I wear a 38C.
How would MAGA react if Putin decided to name the Bering Sea that borders Russia and Alaska after himself?
People are placing a lot of responsibility on Democrats to save our country. What we need is for the Republicans to finally grow a spine, turn against Trump, and work with the Democrats.

A few years ago, I introduced my young daughter to Independence Day. Her takeaway: Aliens are stinky. Mine has always been: Bill Pullman is the bravest and hottest American president on film ever. I wish he was ours today.

My suggestion for the Democrats tonight: Laugh at Trump when he lies. That throws him off more than booing. He doesn’t handle it well psychologically. Laughter is an impulsive reaction, but booing is intentional. No need to be classless and rude.

I had an umbrella that was not opening or closing well. One rainstorm, I closed it and got in my car. I shut the door. The umbrella suddenly opened to its full range, hitting the windshield & pinning me awkwardly in my seat. I fought like Dennis Nedry against the frilled dinosaur, car rocking.
My admiration level for Mike Meyers is immense. He aged like a fine wine, and he isn’t afraid to take a public stand for Trump and his cult to see.
Never choose to lie when the truth is easily found.

I have noticed that fewer men are wearing MAGA hats in public than the first time around. I hope they all decide to go buy ill-fitting suits, abnormally long ties, and eyeliner so normal people can identify them.

Zelenskyy is a far better adult than I am. My red-headed temper would have gotten hold of me. Me, standing up, giving Trump and Vance a thorough Julia Sugarbakering that would have made my Southern grandma proud, and walking out as they kept yelling.

MAGA: “Trump promised during the campaign that he would not touch Medicaid.” MAGA: Trump said he didn’t know about Project 2025.” They are acting like campaign speeches are contracts. Nope. He said what he did to trick you into voting for him. The rest of us know that. Sympathy level is zero.

I turned on a movie last night. I realized that I must have fallen asleep for about half an hour, because I opened my eyes and didn’t recognize anyone on the screen. I also didn’t know why people were shooting each other. Getting older is hard.
I am really tired of adulting today. Paying bills, wearing shoes, using manners, not killing people. Blargh.

The sad thing is that MAGA believes there are “high value” and “low value” people. They want the low to die. Old. Poor. Homeless. Mentally ill. Chronic diseases. Children of single moms. This is why Medicaid is on the chopping block. It is financial eugenics.

America walks into a restaurant, going by life-long friends without a second glance to sit with the drunkards in the back. The ones who are harassing the waitress, taking food off other people’s plates, screaming obscenities, and picking fights. This is who we are now in the eyes of the world.

If I hadn’t changed my name when I got married, I definitely wouldn’t do so now with the SAVE act shenanigans. Married women: get a passport. If you had one that expired within the last 5 years you can still renew online. Divorcing: the decree must include a restoration of your former name.

I hate Hitler. Mass murder. Invading countries. Looting art. Eugenics. Racism. My grandfather was in WWII. He made it back, but 405,399 did not. It dishonors their memory for any so-called American to do a Nazi salute or read Mein Kampf regularly as a favorite book. Nazis = the bad guys.

I am loving that town halls are filled with people willing to boo their congressional representatives. Maybe politicians will realize that standing up to Trump is a better political move than kissing his ass. The people want strong-willed leaders who will stand up for America.
The Law Regarding the Dropping of Round Foods in the Kitchen: Said food will always roll under the least accessible appliance, one where you are reluctant to put your fingers.

Trump saying Ukraine started things reminds me of schools with such a strict no fighting policy that they punish both parties regardless of fault. I told my son to hit back. I tell Ukraine to keep hitting back. Trump has no standing to negotiate anything, and it would be 2-1.
French Hill, if you have never met him, is exactly the type of person you envision when you ask yourself who would write a bill to RAISE bank overdraft fees for customers.
I think my Social Security number is going to see more action this week than the DOGE Dweebs have in the past 4 years.
I have seen lots of presidents in my life. Some I liked more than others. I always respected them though. Until one horrible, orange, and corrupt person ended that.
Sometimes you just need to be outside, looking at a beautiful view. It makes life better, and you feel at peace.

Super powers: I think teleportation would be better than flying….for my hair. It’s hard to be a superhero with long locks getting in your eyes. No cape, skirt, or excessive cleavage either. I would want to be taken seriously as I save the world.
You deserve much better than a chalky heart-shaped candy with a pithy phrase. You, my dearest, should receive the biggest, most spectacular, and glitter-adorned Valentine in the entire box!
The highlight of my day yesterday was petting a mini Aussie puppy with bright blue eyes. Her nickname was Piranha. Apparently she could be a bit nibbly. My heart exploded at the cuteness!

I am enjoying all the countries standing up to American insanity. Denmark, Mexico, Egypt, and Canada get top marks. All personal mocking of the Orange in the White House is also appropriate, here and abroad.

The people who take forever to fall asleep and then wake up in the middle of the night (me) always end up married to the ones who fall asleep in 30 seconds and sleep all night long (him, who is really lucky not to be smothered).
You never outgrow unfortunately located zits, in case you wondered.
I didn’t have Trump dissing everyone with a peanut allergy on my “Orange Gaffes” Bingo card. It’s not that they don’t like peanuts—it’s that they are big fans of staying alive.
I don’t camp where bears are. I don’t swim in shark-filled waters. I don’t hang out with cannibals. Mostly because I know that I am totally delicious.
I speak fluent sarcasm. I offer interpretive dance and explanatory PowerPoints for those who need translations. Doing my part for The Resistance!
Women attorneys know that male attorneys like to greet them with an arm around their waists or shoulders. They always seem surprised when I present my hand for shaking.

I saw a pretty dog walking her human around the block. I said “Who is a good girl?” to the dog. The owner said, “She is shy and doesn’t like people.” At that exact moment, that good girl dragged him my way so I could give her some loving. He was shocked. I know a good girl when I see her!

Last year, my husband had surgery to remove a cancerous spot on his ear and rebuild the area. It bled a lot the first day. When it was time to see how it healed, it definitely looked like bits were missing. Still does. It’s not like he was shot in the ear and had a miraculous next-day recovery.
Who wants to bet that Musk’s mini batallion of 19 to 24-year-old DOGE brownshirts got beat up regularly on the playground for ratting out their classmates to the teacher?

In summer 2018, I visited Belize. TVs were tuned to Faux News, and I heard many men praising Trump to tourists. That same year, I went to England. No Faux at all, and one of my favorite store sightings was an angry Trump style dog chew toy on clearance. He wasn’t good enough for their dogs to bite!

You wanna know what adulting as an introvert is? Having the house to yourself on a Friday night, watching gloriously stupid movies on Prime, eating popcorn, and going to bed early because of the peace and quiet.

Something that needs to be said to half of America: Don't pee on my leg and tell me it's raining. Don't push me down and blame gravity. Don’t lie to me and say it’s the truth. Don’t say you’re not a Nazi when all you need is the stupid mustache. Really, just don't.

I was entangled in my sheets. I was yanking on them when they suddenly came loose. My hand continued its upward momentum….and I punched myself hard in the face. Feeling for damage, a rough spot on my fingernail gouged the side of my nose. I look like the loser of a bar fight in Thailand.

I registered as an Independent long ago. In these turbulent times I recommend it. Potential employers can look you up. Reporters too. You have often heard about the party registration of someone in the news. Also, if you resist on social media, don’t use your real name. Crazy people can find you.

Me: I would be a great dog! Tail-wagging happiness. Loves pettings! Can bark and bite strangers. Enjoys walks. He (who does not have the affection I do for canines): True, and you do shed a lot. All you need is a bunch of fleas, and you would be exact.
It is wise to keep enemies at arm's length. I really need longer arms.
I spent a few hours reading posts, liking, commenting, and following. It was immensely entertaining! Your skywriting is top-notch, making Bluesky the best site.

Marriage scientific study: He talks to the tv when she is trying to relax at night. She tells him that the people on the tv can’t hear him, and that she is not paying attention to whatever has him riled up. Note: I can’t confirm that the male does this when not in the presence of the female.
According to science, love doesn’t make the world go around. According to me, it sure makes a more interesting spin.
Last night, it was my duty to save mankind from the alien invasion even though I was injured in both legs and was carrying around someone’s baby. My dream self is badass.

I helped my daughter with a task. Upon conclusion- Her: Thanks! You have earned a contraband margarita for when you’re in a nursing home. Me, excited that there is a margarita list and knowing that I am a super good mom: Yay! How many have I earned so far? Her: One.

Humans are mammals, but they aren’t designed for frigid environments. No layer of thick blubber. Not covered in an insulating pelt. Not even a waterproof layer of feathers. I know my place—inside by a fire, thankful for central heat and a roof and wishing all of us could be so fortunate.

Every time that I drop my shampoo in the shower, I recall that it used to come in glass bottles. I would have accidentally cut off several toes in the olden days. Maybe even bled out, with filthy hair.
Here I am—watching a movie, drinking wine and not caring about Carrie Underpants or Snoopy or anything political at all.
Mississippi and Alabama are the only states celebrating Robert E. Lee today, sharing recognition with Martin Luther King, Jr. In 2017, Arkansas stopped honoring Lee.

I think that it wasn’t the cold that prompted the inauguration move, it was the wind. That thing on his head would have become airborne. The solution would be a nice wool hat, but Trump only owns cheap ball caps.

In the American South, Chinese laborers were brought over to replace slaves as field hands after the Civil War. It didn’t go well, and eventually many opened grocery stores. They occupied an interesting niche between the white and black communities.

One time, I had a hearing, made my arguments, and the judge agreed with me. Afterwards I looked in the mirror and saw that I had blue ink ON MY FACE. It was there the whole time. I was mortified until I realized that I WON DESPITE THE INK ON MY FACE! Lesson: words matter more than appearance.

I think it will be truly funny when Trump does something so egregiously awful that the sycophants at Fox turn on him and dog him non-stop. Right now they are worshipping him like the second coming of orange Jesus.

The best thing about being an adult is being able to NOT do the things that you don’t wanna do. (Obviously not job things, gotta do those.) But optional stuff, mind-numbingly boring events, or inaugurations of felons, I not so respectfully decline to participate. And nobody can make me.

My city has a Duck Crossing. There’s a legit sign to mark the spot where they cross a busy street to enjoy a pond at a country club. (Posh ducks!) Faith in humanity restored when 8 cars in both directions stop and wait patiently for 30+ ducks to cross. No revving engines, no cussing, no horns.

Resistance is not futile. Future generations will know that I never supported Trump. I expect that as more crazy things happen that affect them, MAGA will stop praising him. Seriously, when was the last time you heard an older person boasting about voting for Nixon? He won his race. Same principle.

I have disliked Trump since the 80s and 90s when I would see his smarmy face on tabloids at the grocery store. Nauseating, skeezy, sleazy, immoral, vacuous, ugly, disgusting, trashy man…I could never have imagined the damn fool would be elected president by other damn fools.
If you have an eyeball and you have toothpaste, it’s best to keep them away from each other. Lesson learned and shared for the good of all.

Don’t just repost the same 100 accounts that always get shared-do your own skywriting! Be generous with the hearts! Graduation-heart! Birthday! Beautiful picture! Cute pet! Funny anecdote about a kid! Hearts for you all!! Keep it going! The more interaction you have, the better the site will be.
I live in Arkansas, where there are laws that dictate that at the forecast of snow, each person must stockpile bread, milk and toilet paper.
As I watered my parched and droopy plant this morning, I was pleased to note that the people who live in my house can fend for themselves, and they don’t droop. Plant guilt is hard enough.

Tale of a clumsy gal. I foraged in the fridge. A container of tomato soup was on the top shelf. It fell off! The lid went one way & the container tumbled down the other. I am short, & tomato soup covered me like a Cambell’s version of Carrie. In my hair, my clothes, even my shoes. Moral:Check lids!
The couple in the Cybertruck probably expected me to be envious, because they seemed surprised when I pointed and laughed.

I wish that all the scantily clad gals trying to follow me realized that I would be a terrible companion who is completely uninterested in their wares. Also, anyone who ever posted a revealing profile picture might just encounter a bot using it for several accounts. I have seen repeats.
Violence is not a good response. Sarcasm is not illegal, so I am sticking with that.
I am not rich enough to commit a crime and get away with it.

I recommend watching the Designated Survivor series on Netflix. I missed it the first time around. Kiefer Sutherland is excellent, and it’s eerie how the show predicted certain things that actually happened.

Movies set in Washington have shown me that spies are always meeting in the public spaces, leaving big envelopes hidden behind trash cans, or putting a USB under a bench. Knowing my luck, my dog would find one, and my life would be a bizarre thriller where I proclaim innocence and point at my dog.
May 2025 bring you more joys than sorrows and more laughs than tears.
It’s New Year’s Eve. If you’re not on a cruise, your chance of being upside down in the middle of the ocean tonight is zero. Be safe out there, people.
A foggy morning makes me think I should be in a gothic novel, searching for my true love on the moors and looking smashing in black.

I, a blue dot, have a business in a red state. I can’t say anything overly political for fear of damaging my livelihood. I know that is how it will be for at least the next four years. I find that keeping my social media focus on humor and dogs is a safe bet.

If I won billions in a lottery, I would pay off public school lunch debt for kids, give my local library a huge donation, set up scholarships at local colleges, adopt all the dogs, and become quite eccentric. I would like to test these theories.
The best thing about being your own boss is deciding just how long your office is closed for the holidays. The next best is always selecting yourself as Employee of the Month.
I watched The Six Triple Eight today. It was the best movie I have seen in a while. Kerry Washington deserves an Oscar for this. I give it two thumbs up for cast, script and directing.

I was unaware that organized fox hunts were outlawed in England. In America, fox hunts are supposed to emphasize the chase, not the kill. I like foxes, probably because of Disney’s Robin Hood to be honest.
Today is when many bad parents return toys donated to their children to get things for themselves. It helps if you take a sharpie to the barcode before donating.
The Grinch experienced the joy of Christmas, and his heart grew 3 sizes. But I believe that his dog Max always knew he was good deep down. Dogs recognize good people.
If you are going to watch one Christmas movie this year, it should be the Muppet Christmas Carol with Michael Caine.

One Christmas, it had snowed & iced, but we loaded up the car to head to the in-laws about 2 hours north. On the way, we passed a wrecked car that was upside down, with presents spilling out the back onto the snow. I vowed then that no holiday was so vital that I would travel in dangerous weather.

My husband’s younger brother died yesterday. I wish there were some way to treat addiction disorders once and for all, although I know that liquor, tobacco and pharmaceutical companies would resist any research into it.

People wonder how Arkansas ended up with the disastrous Sarah Huckabee Sanders as governor. Here racism outweighs misogyny. Her opponent was a well-spoken and highly-educated man, who happens to be black. That was unacceptable to all the Trump cultists.
Arkansas is also #40 in economy, #47 in healthcare and #49 in crime but go off.
Some people could host their own show titled “How to Beautifully Wrap Anything.” Mine always look like a crime scene—rough stabbed edges, a bit of blood, and hair everywhere.
If you wrap the present, you are entitled to give yourself top billing on the label. It’s the law of Wrapper’s Privilege.

I remember an assignment in elementary school (back in the 1970s) where the teacher had all the boys describe what they would do as President. All the girls were supposed to say what they would do as First Lady. We haven’t made much progress, but I do hope that we moved beyond this.
Ever since Amazon started shipping more things in envelopes, it has gotten more difficult for me to wrap Christmas gifts. I don’t have enough boxes!

I try to guess “What is the dumbest thing he could do today?” Then I read about the latest ambassador pick/policy idea, and he is always significantly dumber than I give him credit for—which is pretty damn dumb.
The Chipmunks should not be the top of anybody’s Christmas music list, especially when the competition includes Bing, Nat, and Burl.
When a second grade student makes a 911 call about an active shooter, banning phones in schools seems to be counterproductive.
Of all the 12 days of Christmas stuff from my true love, I only really want the gold rings and maybe the pear tree.
In England—It’s common to leave a mince pie and mulled wine for Santa, with a carrot for the reindeer. Thanks for this cute tidbit, Rick Steves.
My husband is my Hubby Biscuits, Butter Buns and Stud Muffin. I will contemplate the similarities in those nicknames while watching a documentary on cannibalism, just to make him nervous.

The main game changer in how men treat women is the cellphone. Men should always behave as if someone is filming them, recording what they say, and forwarding all inappropriate pictures. (Side note: women will not suddenly find you irresistible if you send a picture of your naked mole rat.)
Do not use the word “females” about humans, especially if you are a man. Huge red flag.
Maybe big corporations should have active shooter drills. School teachers and third graders are pros who could show them how to do it.
If mass shootings happened to rich men on golf courses and yacht clubs, the gun issues would have been dealt with long ago.
People are freaking out more over the shooting of a billionaire longer than they did over any school shooting.
Thursday would be better if it actually involved Thor.
It would be a lot easier to stay on Santa’s Nice List if being Naughty weren’t so fun.
This highlights how your dog or cat is treated better than any woman in your life.

The only plus to my fridge dying is that I tossed out food from 2009. (I protest weakly that I am not a hoarder.) I also cleaned the whole thing so it looks like the day it was delivered. Except it worked that day….

I am short. I often find that what I need is on a top shelf at the grocery store, and there’s no friendly giant around to help me. Like others of my kind, I have mastered the shelf climb. It’s amazing how fast store personnel arrive to chastise me, but I am already back down with an innocent look.
I love subtitles! Some theaters say that they offer equipment for the hearing impaired, but I have never seen it being used.
Chocolate is always a part of my Christmas decor. It never gets tangled like a string of lights.

The worst part of my day is when I am wide awake more than an hour before my alarm is set to go off. I know it’s not enough time to get more sleep, and I don’t want to be productive by getting up early.
I love how President Biden is still showing his power and authority. Pardoning Hunter was the right choice.
I agree 100%.
Venice is a beautiful city. GPS makes exploring it easy. There is always something wonderful to see, even in the wee hours of the night.

Last week I looked at my fridge and thought how nice it was that it had no problems since the day I got it in 2018. The universe rewarded me with tepid milk and limp frozen pizza today. I must have the doom and gloom version of psychic abilities.
If you are the scientist villain in a movie, you must have a lah-boor-a-tor-ee. Otherwise, we won’t know that you are truly evil.
This definitely feels like my third Saturday this week. I suspect that Monday will be especially difficult.
I have gotten an email or 10 from every company I bought anything from this year in the past week (or 24 hours).

I don’t think the modern online generation realizes that people would eat Thanksgiving dinner, go stand in a line at a store, get into fights to buy things and sometimes die. Black Friday sales were stupid.
The best thing about being a grown up is that nobody can force you to eat the parts of a Thanksgiving meal that you don’t like.

My Thanksgiving included a quick lesson to my BIL about the statute of limitations on collecting credit card debt and how to avoid restarting it. I also emphasized the importance of responding to a lawsuit when you are served with it. Things can go really wrong otherwise.
Deviled eggs divide families more vociferously than politics. (I am anti.)

Many people depend on donations to food pantries. Don’t donate the cheap powdered mac and cheese, because that requires rare and expensive butter and milk. Donate the deluxe variety with the cheese sauce packet included, so nothing extra is needed. Donate pots and pans too.

Most glaring script error in Gladiator II: Hose him off. The ancient Romans had hoses? Otherwise, I enjoyed the movie. Pedro is always a favorite, and Denzel could read the phone book to a googly-eyed me.
I just realized that Jeff Goldblum is the wizard in Wicked. I think that alone makes it worth watching. I’ve had a crush on him since Earth Girls are Easy!

Sometimes, like most women, I feel that my husband rightfully deserves to be flipped the bird by me. But I flip and say “Bink” so he knows that I still love him. Otherwise, I would be calling a coroner.

Sign of wealth: pajamas. These are clothes just to sleep in. There are kids who dislike Pajama Day at school, because while rich children have a lot of options (including buying a new set), poor children can and do feel excluded. This also applies to other dress up days as part of Spirit Week.

Magas and family rift: think about how you had Fox blaring when they came to visit, recall that flag or bumper sticker you displayed, remember the silence when you mocked the other side…and know, for the future, that keeping your vote/political opinion private is priceless for keeping harmony.

Mom’s house: Little House on the Prairie rerun is on. Johnny Cash is the guest star. How did I not know he was a great actor? He stole the show as a conman playing at being a preacher. June Carter Cash played his wife.
I will never say that I have too many pockets. I need *all* the pockets to make up for the fake and unusable ones that I have been subjected to. Reincarnate me as a kangaroo!
